head.supplied: ¶ That £100.- .- be placed at the disposal of the Section for vegetable products ¶ to obtain some material for exhibition that cannot be obtained without direct outlay &c to enable the section to ar...

div.p: Unit 3, VPRS 927/P0000 Correspondence relating to various exhibitions, Trustees of the Public Library, Museums and National Gallery of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

MS in M's handwriting, on a sheet with the Board of Agriculture's letterhead, annotated 'Memo | Dr Mueller'. There are further annotations, in a different hand: '[Passed] 50 on an amendment of Mr Bindon' and '£30 for gems'.
That £100.- .- be placed at the disposal of the Section for vegetable products
Of the International Exhibition of Australasia, Melbourne, 1866-7. M was one of the Commissioners of the Exhibition. Item dated to 1866 since this was when the exhibits were being organized. Meetings of the Commission were held in the offices of the Board of Agriculture and M may have prepared his memo during a meeting. to obtain some material for exhibition that cannot be obtained without direct outlay &c to enable the section to arrange for the preparation of articles by chemical processes from vegetable substances.
